com.marketxs.messaging
Interface ManagableConfiguratorMBean

All Known Implementing Classes:
ManagableConfigurator
public interface ManagableConfiguratorMBean

Author:
Erik van Zijst - erik@marketxs.com - 22.oct.2003

Method Detail

getState

public State getState()

Returns the current state of the messaging library.

Returns:
the current library state.

start

public void start()
           throws InvalidStateException

Starts up the messaging library. This spawns the kernel thread and allows you to start adding interfaces.

Throws:
InvalidStateException

stop

public void stop()
          throws InvalidStateException,
                 java.lang.InterruptedException

Stops the messaging library. When this method returns successfully, the kernel (router) thread and the TCPListener will be stopped and the interfaces disabled and removed.

Throws:
InvalidStateException - when the library is not currently running.
java.lang.InterruptedException

getRouterAddress

public java.lang.String getRouterAddress()

Returns the router address that will be used after the next invocation of the activate() method.

Returns:
the new router address.

setRouterAddress

public void setRouterAddress(java.lang.String addr)
                      throws InvalidAddressException

Use this method to specifiy the router's address. Note that this address will become active only after the router has been deactivated first. The Kernel MBean shows the real address used by the router.

Parameters:
addr - the address to be used after the next activate() invocation.
Throws:
InvalidAddressException - when the the specified address is invalid.

forceRouterAddress

public void forceRouterAddress(java.lang.String addr)
                        throws InvalidAddressException,
                               java.lang.InterruptedException

While the setRouterAddress() method simply tells the router to use a new address at next startup, this method will actually force the router to be restarted. Also, it restores the interface configuration. In short: when this method completes successfully, the router will be in the same state as it was before invocation.

Parameters:
addr -
Throws:
InvalidAddressException
java.lang.InterruptedException

getInterfaces

public java.lang.String[] getInterfaces()

Returns an array of strings that each contain information about a single interface. The format of the strings is as follows:

0 (tr25.iface4 @ tr25.marketxs.com:5000): Interface enabled, but not connected.

Returns:
an array of strings that each contain one interface.

addInterface

public void addInterface(java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String peerAddress,
                         java.lang.String hostname,
                         int port)
                  throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                         InterfaceIDException,
                         InvalidAddressException
Adds a new interface to the router kernel. The interface's id must be unique among the node's interfaces.

Parameters:
id - the id of the new interface.
peerAddress - the address of the peer interface this interface will connect to.
hostname - the hostname or IP address of the neighbor node.
port - the IP port number of the neighbor node.
Throws:
InvalidAddressException - when the peerAddress is syntactically incorrect.
InterfaceIDException - when the specified id is not locally unique.
java.net.UnknownHostException

removeInterface

public void removeInterface(java.lang.String id)
                     throws InterfaceIDException
Removes the interface with the specified id. This method throws an InterfaceIDException when there is no interface configured with the given id.

Parameters:
id - the id of the interface that is to be removed.
Throws:
InterfaceIDException - when the specified id does not match that of any existing interface.

activateInterface

public void activateInterface(java.lang.String id)
                       throws InterfaceIDException
Activates the interface with the specified id. When an interface is activated, it will actively try to establish a connection with its peer. When activated, the interface will use one or more internal daemon threads.

Parameters:
id - the id of the interface that is to be activated.
Throws:
InterfaceIDException - when the specified id does not match that of any existing interface.

deactivateInterface

public void deactivateInterface(java.lang.String id)
                         throws InterfaceIDException
Deactivates the interface with the specified id. When an interface is deactivated, it will disconnect from its peer and not try to reconnect anymore. When an interface is deactivated it does not use any internal daemon threads or other active resources. When there is no interface configured with the given id, this method throws an InterfaceIDException.

Parameters:
id - the id of the interface that is to be removed.
Throws:
InterfaceIDException - when the specified id does not match that of any existing interface.

removeInterfaces

public void removeInterfaces()

Removes all interfaces, active or inactive. It is essentially an atomic version of: 

 ifaces = getInterfaces();
 foreach iface in ifaces
 do
 	removeInterface(iface);
 done
